subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Rise of the 'Nones': No Religion, More Meaning
description: One-minute skill: The Rise of the 'Nones': No Religion, More Meaning.

hook.text: One in three young Americans has no religious affiliation. They're called 'nones.' But they're not all atheists.

buildup.text: The 'nones' reject institutions, not meaning. Many believe in God, pray, or identify as spiritual. Labels are outdated.

discovery.text: Church scandals, political partisanship, and rigid doctrine drove them away. The exit is about institutions, not God.

twist.text: Many 'nones' are lonely. Without a faith community, they lose social bonds that churches once provided for free.

climax.text: The 'nones' prove that religion as an institution is failing. But the human need for meaning and connection persists.

punchline.text: Young people left religion, not meaning. The institution failed them.

quiz.question: Who are the 'nones'?
options: People with no religious affiliation, many of whom still hold spiritual beliefs
